meanings.definition: To correct too much or too strongly in response to an error or mistake.
meanings.sent1: She kept overcorrecting her spelling mistakes, making her writing look unnatural.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcorrect his golf swing, which sometimes leads to even worse shots.
meanings.sent3: The robot, programmed to overcorrect every movement, ended up walking in zigzags.
meanings.sent4: Her constant overcorrecting of the steering wheel made the car feel like a wild horse.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's overcorrecting of every tiny error made the students anxious about making mistakes.

meanings.definition: The act of making excessive corrections in an attempt to fix a problem.
meanings.sent1: His overcorrecting of the document led to confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The overcorrecting of the budget caused delays in the project completion.
meanings.sent3: The overcorrecting of his outfit made him look like he was wearing a costume.
meanings.sent4: The overcorrecting of the painting's colors gave it a surreal and dreamlike quality.
meanings.sent5: The overcorrecting of the recipe ingredients resulted in a dish that tasted strange.
